metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9772 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient sanitisation in the OCaml compiler versions 4.04.0 and 4.04.1 allows external code to be executed with raised privilege in binaries marked as setuid, by setting the CAML_CPLUGINS, CAML_NATIVE_CPLUGINS, or CAML_BYTE_CPLUGINS environment variable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9772` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ocaml - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
ocaml-base - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
ocaml-base-nox - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
ocaml-compiler-libs - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
ocaml-interp - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
ocaml-mode - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
ocaml-nox - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
ocaml-source - 4.05.0-10ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Look for further modifications that would handle filesystem capabilities or other reasons for `AT_SECURE` to be set in getauxval(3). mdeslaur> only affects 4.04.0 and 4.04.1

criterions.comment: ocaml package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.05.0-10ubuntu1').
